rule: The output must never consist of only one word, and it must represent an invalid part-of-speech tag or any unaccepted option other than "Unknown" or "CantAnswer".
input: sentence: I found a python book., word: python
validityText:
The input provides a sentence "I found a python book." and a word "python". The sentence is a grammatically valid string containing multiple words. The sentence does not contain special characters or symbols beyond standard punctuation (period). The word "python" is a substring of the sentence. The word "python" does not include punctuation. All requirements of the input specification are met.
OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output provides a single word "NOUN", which appears to be a part-of-speech tag. The description specifies a list of allowed tags, and "NOUN" is a valid tag, corresponding to NN, NNS, NNP, or NNPS. The output also adheres to the requirement of returning only the part-of-speech tag.
OK
